error.signature: Error: Maximum update depth exceeded. This can happen when a component calls setState inside useEffect

verdict.summary: useEffect triggers a state update that re-triggers the effect in an infinite loop.

dead_ends.action: Adding a counter to limit the number of updates
dead_ends.why_fails: Adds complexity without fixing the root cause; effect still fires unnecessarily
May break the feature that needs the side effect

workarounds.action: Add correct dependencies to the useEffect dependency array
workarounds.how: Ensure deps don't change on every render â€” avoid object/array literals in deps

workarounds.action: Use useMemo/useCallback for deps that are computed values or functions
workarounds.how: Memoization prevents the dependency from changing on every render

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Both produce similar messages, but 'maximum-update-depth-exceeded' and 'objects-not-valid-as-child' differ in root cause and environment context.
'Error' indicates excessive state update depth (likely useEffect loop), while 'Minified React error #XXX; visit https' indicates a minified production React error.
